title: 107_hr2252
content: The Act titled "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of conduit contribution ban. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases civil and criminal penalties for knowing and willful violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Civil penalties are now not less than 300 percent of the amount involved in the violation and not more than the greater of $50,000 or 1000 percent of the amount involved. Criminal penalties have also been increased for those who knowingly and willfully commit violations. The Act "Conduit Contribution Prevention Act of 2001" increases penalties for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. Criminal penalties for knowingly and willfully committing violations involving $1,000 or more include fines, imprisonment for up to 2 years, or both. The fine must be at least 300 percent of the amount involved, not exceeding $50,000 or 1000 percent of the violation amount. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for these penalties. The United States Sentencing Commission will establish guidelines for penalties for violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971, taking into account variations in the contribution amount. The guideline must be promulgated within 90 days of the Act's enactment. The United States Sentencing Commission is required to promulgate guidelines for penalties related to violations of the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 within 90 days of the Act's enactment. Additionally, there are amendments made to sections of the Act regarding referrals to the Attorney General and the statute of limitations for violations. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 is amended to extend the statute of limitations to 5 years for violations of section 320. These amendments apply to violations occurring after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. Extension of ban on foreign contributions to all campaign-related disbursements, including disbursements to political committees and for independent expenditures. Effective date applies to disbursements made after the enactment of this Act.
